column1: 768*{'text': 'Pepin the Short (714–768)
column3: dies; he is succeeded by his sons Carloman (eastern Franks) and Charles

column1: 768*{'text': 'Deventer (in the present day Netherlands) is founded (approximate date).'
768*{'text': 'Aurelio succeeds Fruela I as king of Asturias.'
768*{'text': 'The date
column3: when Wales begins to celebrate Easter on the Roman date

column1: 768*{'date': 'August 7'
column2: 'text': 'Pope Stephen III succeeds Pope Paul I as the 94th pope.'

column1: 769*{'text': 'Pope Stephen III holds a council; papal election procedure is changed and the devotion to icons is confirmed.'
769*{'text': 'The Monastery of Tallaght is founded by Máel Ruain.'
762*{'date': 'July 30'
column2: 'text': 'Abbasid caliph al-Mansur founds a new capital at Baghdad

column1: 762*{'text': 'Tang military leader Li Fuguo kills the wife of Suzong
column3: and shortly afterward Suzong dies of a heart attack; Daizong kills Li.'

column1: 763*{'text': 'Ciniod succeeds Bridei V as king of the Picts.'
763*{'date': 'November 18'
column2: 'text': "Tibetan forces occupy the Chinese capital Chang'an of the Tang Dynasty for 16 days."

column1: 760*{'text': 'The Maya city of Dos Pilas is abandoned.'
760*{'text': 'Emperor Xuanzong is placed under house arrest by Li Fuguo with the support of Emperor Suzong.'
760*{'text': 'The church of Santa Sophia in Benevento is built (approximate date).'
760*{'text': 'The Kailash Temple is built on the orders of Krishna I of the Rashtrakutas.'
761*{'text': 'Bridei V succeeds Onuist as king of the Picts.'
761*{'text': 'The city of Oviedo is founded by Máximo and Fromestano.'
761*{'text': "An Abbasid army reconquers Kairouan from 'Abd al-Rahman Ibn Rustam."
766*{'date': 'November 16'
767*{'text': 'The Kharijite Berbers of Tlemcen and Tiaret try to conquer Ifriqiya (Tunisia) from the Abbasid caliphate but fail to conquer the capital
767*{'text': 'A period of anarchy begins in Bulgaria.'
767*{'text': 'Constantine II becomes antipope.'
764*{'text': 'Mauricius Galba becomes Doge of Venice.'
764*{'text': 'Offa of Mercia conquers Kent
column2: and installs Egbert II on the Kentish throne.'

column1: 765*{'text': 'The Zenete Berber tribe of Banû Ifrân rebels against the Abbasids and creates an independent state centered around Tlemcen.'
765*{'text': 'Papal privileges are restored in Beneventino and Tuscany (and partly in Spoleto).'
765*{'text': 'Kasuga Shrine
719*{'text': 'Charles Martel defeats king Radbod of the Frisians.'
719*{'text': 'The West Saxon monk Winifrid is sent by Pope Gregory II
column2: who gives him the name Boniface
column3: to evangelize in Germany and reorganize the church there.'

column1: 719*{'text': 'The church of Nubia transfers its allegiance from the Eastern Orthodox Church to the Coptic Church.'
718*{'text': "Tervel's reign as monarch of Bulgaria ends."
718*{'text': 'Saint Boniface sets out for Frisia a second time.'
718*{'text': 'Emperor Leo III and Khan Tervel defeat Arab forces besieging Constantinople
column2: stopping a large Arab incursion towards Europe.'

column1: 718*{'text': "The world's oldest hotel
717*{'date': 'March 21'
column2: 'text': 'The Battle of Vincy is fought between Charles Martel and Ragenfrid.'

column1: 717*{'date': 'March 25'
column2: 'text': 'Leo III usurps the throne of Byzantium.'

column1: 717*{'date': 'August 15'
column2: 'text': 'Maslamah begins the Second Arab siege of Constantinople.'

column1: 717*{'date': 'December 24'
column2: 'text': 'An earthquake shakes many places in northern Syria
column3: and destroys the Old Church of Edessa.'

column1: 717*{'text': 'Umayyad caliph al-Walid I ibn Abd al-Malik is succeeded by Sulayman ibn Abd al-Malik.'
717*{'text': "Hoshi Ryokan
716*{'text': 'Inal Khan succeeds Kapagan Khan and Bilge Khan succeeds Inal Khan in the Turkish Empire.'
716*{'text': 'Theodosius III leads a revolt against Anastasius II and is proclaimed Byzantine Emperor.'
716*{'text': 'The Ummayads conquer Lisbon.'
716*{'date': 'April 19'
column2: 'text': 'The monastery on the Island of Iona celebrates Easter on the Roman date.'

column1: 715*{'text': 'A major earthquake hits Turkey.'
715*{'text': 'Umayyad caliph al-Walid I ibn Abd al-Malik is succeeded by Sulayman ibn Abd al-Malik.'

column2: 'text': 'Pope Gregory II succeeds Pope Constantine as the 89th pope.'

column1: 715*{'date': 'August 11'
column2: 'text': 'Germanus is translated from the bishopric of Cyzicus to the Patriarch of Constantinople.'

column1: 715*{'text': 'Saint Boniface sets out on a missionary expedition to the Frisians.'
715*{'text': 'The Grand Mosque of Damascus is built over the Cathedral of St. John the Baptist.'
715*{'text': 'Saint Winnin
column3: lands at the mouth of the River Garnock
column4: where he establishes a community or cell of monks

column1: 714*{'date': 'February 28'
714*{'text': "The Tibetan invasion of China's Tang Dynasty is defeated."
714*{'text': "Emperor Xuanzong of Tang forbids all commercial vendors and shops in the Chinese capital city of Chang'an to copy and sell Buddhist sutras
column2: so that the emperor can give the clergy of the Buddhist monasteries the sole right to distribute written sutras to the laity."

column1: 714*{'text': 'Zaragoza falls to the Arab armies of Musa bin Nusair.'
713*{'text': 'Byzantine Emperor Philippicus is deposed; Anastasius II is made emperor.'
713*{'text': 'The Arabs under al-Abbas ibn al-Walid sack Antioch in Pisidia
713*{'text': 'Emperor Xuanzong of Tang starts to rule in Ancient China.'
713*{'text': 'The Islamic community at Multan is founded.'
713*{'text': 'Seville and Mérida fall to the Arab armies of Musa bin Nusair.'
712*{'text': 'Ansprand succeeds Aripert as king of the Lombards.'
712*{'date': 'June 12'
column2: 'text': 'Liutprand succeeds his father Ansprand as king of the Lombards.'

column1: 712*{'text': 'Emperor Xuanzong of Tang China succeeds Emperor Ruizong of Tang China as emperor of China.'
712*{'text': 'The Kojiki
711*{'date': 'April 30'
column2: 'text': 'Ummayad troops led by Tariq ibn Ziyad land at Gibraltar
column3: and begin their invasion of the Iberian peninsula and conquest of the Visigothic Kingdom (See Moors

column1: 711*{'text': 'Childebert III died and is succeeded by Dagobert III as king of Austrasia.'
711*{'text': "Philippicus incites a revolt against Justinian II
column2: and upon the latter's death declares himself Byzantine Emperor."

column1: 710*{'text': 'The Asuka period
column2: the second and last part of the Yamato period
column4: and the Nara period begins in Japan; Heijō-kyō (Nara) becomes the capital of Japan.'

column1: 710*{'text': 'The Byzantine general Leo (the future emperor Leo III) recovers Abasgia for the Byzantine Empire from the Arabs.'
710*{'text': 'The Muslim Kingdom of Nekor is founded in Morocco.'
710*{'text': 'A Muslim army is invited into Ceuta by its governor
column5: encourages them to invade the Iberian peninsula.'

column1: 710*{'text': 'Roderic deposes Achila to become king of the Visigoths.'
710*{'text': 'The isolated Byzantine outpost of Cherson in the Crimea rebels with Khazar assistance
710*{'text': 'The first (wooden) Al-Aqsa Mosque is finished.'
708*{'date': 'Byzantine Empire: March'
column2: 'text': 'The Umayyads under Maslamah ibn Abd al-Malik capture and sack the Byzantine city of Tyana after a prolonged siege
column3: and following a victory over a Byzantine relief army.'

column1: 708*{'text': 'The Japanese court is moved from Heian to Nara.'
708*{'text': 'Nazaktar Khan
column2: a Turk Shahi prince in alliance with the Tibetan Kingdom

column1: 708*{'date': 'January 15'
column2: 'text': 'Pope Sisinnius succeeds Pope John VII as the 87th pope.'

column1: 708*{'date': 'March 25'
column2: 'text': 'Pope Constantine succeeds Pope Sisinnius as the 88th pope.'

column1: 709*{'text': 'Saelred becomes king of Essex.'
709*{'text': 'Ceolred becomes king of Mercia
column2: after his cousin Cenred abdicates to become a monk in Rome.'

column1: 709*{'text': 'A storm separates the Channel Islands of Jethou and Herm.'
709*{'text': "Byzantine emperor Justinian II sends a fleet to Italy under the patrikios Theodore
column2: to intervene in the dispute between Pope Constantine and the archbishop Felix of Ravenna
column3: who claimed to be independent of the pope's authority."

column1: 705*{'date': 'March 1'
column2: 'text': 'Pope John VII succeeds Pope John VI (died on 11 January) as the 86th Pope.'

column1: 705*{'text': 'Work begins on the Grand Mosque of Damascus.'
706*{'date': 'July 2'
column2: 'text': "Emperor Zhongzong of Tang had the remains of his mother and recently deceased ruling empress Wu Zetian
column5: and granddaughter Li Xianhui all interred in at the same tomb complex as his father and Wu Zetian's husband Emperor Gaozong (d. 683) outside Chang'an known as the Qianling Mausoleum

column1: 706*{'date': '15 February'
column2: 'text': 'The restored Byzantine emperor Justinian II presides over the public humiliation of his predecessors Leontius and Tiberius III and their chief associates in the Hippodrome of Constantinople

column1: 706*{'text': 'Umayyad Caliph al-Walid I begins the Great Mosque of Damascus.'
707*{'text': 'The first bimaristan (Islamic hospital) is founded in Damascus.'
707*{'text': 'The Byzantines lose the Balearic Islands to the Moors.'
707*{'text': 'A large Umayyad army under Maslamah ibn Abd al-Malik invades Asia Minor and lays siege to Tyana.'
701*{'text': 'Wittiza succeeds his grandfather Ergica as king of the Visigoths.'
701*{'text': 'Liutpert succeeds his father Perctarit as king of the Lombards.'
701*{'text': 'Raginpert overthrows Liutpert and becomes king of the Lombards.'
701*{'text': 'The Code of Taihō is issued in Japan.'
701*{'date': 'October 30'
column2: 'text': 'Pope John VI succeeds Pope Sergius I (died on 8/9 September) as the 85th Pope.'

column1: 702*{'text': 'The Umayyad Mosque at Damascus is completed.'
703*{'text': 'Elias I becomes Catholicos of Armenia.'
797*{'date': 'July 17'
797*{'date': 'August 15'
column2: 'text': "Irene of Athens's orders are carried out; her son is blinded
column3: and she is declared empress the next day."

column1: 796*{'date': 'December'
796*{'text': 'Charlemagne defeats the Avars.'
795*{'text': 'City of Paderborn founded by Charlemagne in Westphalia.'
795*{'date': 'December 26'
column2: 'text': 'Pope Leo III succeeds Pope Adrian I as the 96th pope.'

column1: 794*{'text': 'Kyoto becomes the Japanese capital
793*{'text': 'The Frisian–Frankish wars came to an end with the last uprising of the Frisians in 793.'
793*{'text': 'A jihad under Hisham I takes place.'
793*{'text': 'Offa of Mercia founds an abbey at St Albans.'
792*{'text': 'Irene is confirmed empress of the Byzantine Empire.'
792*{'text': 'The Westphalians rise up against the Saxons (see Charlemagne).'
792*{'text': 'Hisham I calls for a jihad.'
791*{'text': 'The Avars invade Europe again
791*{'text': 'Alfonso II becomes king of Asturias.'
790*{'text': 'A revolt against Empress Irene leads to Constantine VI being declared sole ruler of the Byzantine Empire.'
790*{'text': 'Alcuin returns to England.'
790*{'text': 'Angilbert is made abbot of Saint-Riquier.'
799*{'date': '29 November'
798*{'text': 'Coenwulf of Mercia invades Kent
column2: deposes and imprisons King Eadbert Praen
column3: and makes his own brother Cuthred king.'

column1: 798*{'text': 'Sigered succeeds Sigeric as king of Essex.'
798*{'text': 'Bahlul Ibn Marzuq revolted in Zaragoza against the central government of Muslim Al-Andalus.'
798*{'text': 'Theodulf becomes bishop of Orléans (approximate date).'
784*{'text': 'The Japanese capital moves away from Nara
784*{'text': 'The Chinese engineer and prince Li Gao invents a successful model of a paddle-wheel ship.'
784*{'date': 'August 31'
column2: 'text': 'Paul IV abdicates as Patriarch of Constantinople.'

column1: 784*{'date': 'December 25'
785*{'text': 'Widukind and many other Saxons are baptized.'
785*{'text': 'The Frankish empire conquers Girona from the Moors.'
785*{'text': 'Talorgen succeeds Talorcan II as king of the Picts.'
785*{'text': 'Višeslav becomes ruler of Croatian Dalmatia.'
785*{'text': 'Cologne becomes an archbishopric.'
785*{'text': 'Council of Paderborn.'
786*{'text': 'A council is organized in Constantinople
786*{'date': 'September 14'
column2: 'text': 'Harun al-Rashid becomes the Abbasid Caliph in Baghdad upon the death of his brother al-Hadi
column3: and appoints Salim Yunisi as the Abbasid governor of Sindh and the Indus Valley.'

column1: 786*{'text': 'Beatus of Liébana
column3: publishes his Commentary on the Apocalypse.'

column1: 787*{'text': 'Conall succeeds Drest as king of the Picts.'
787*{'text': 'The Second Council of Nicaea ends the first iconoclastic period in the Byzantine Empire.'
780*{'text': 'September - Constantine VI becomes Byzantine Emperor with Irene as guardian.'
780*{'text': 'Borobudur
780*{'text': 'The king of Silla is killed in a revolt.'
780*{'text': 'Drest III succeeds Alpin II as king of the Picts.'
780*{'text': 'The city of Osnabrück is founded by Charlemagne (approximate date).'
781*{'date': 'July 31'
781*{'text': 'Emperor Kammu succeeds Emperor Kōnin as emperor of Japan.'
781*{'text': 'Charlemagne defines the Papal territory (see Papal States).'
781*{'text': 'Talorcan II succeeds Drest III as king of the Picts.'
781*{'text': "Alcuin becomes Charlemagne's chief adviser on religious and educational matters."
782*{'text': 'Charlemagne summons the monk and scholar Alcuin of York to head the palace school at Aachen in order to inspire the revival of education in Europe.'
782*{'text': 'The Massacre of Verden is ordered by Charlemagne against the Saxons.'
782*{'text': 'Nanchan Temple
788*{'text': 'Charlemagne conquers Bavaria.'
788*{'text': 'Bermudo I succeeds Mauregato as king of Asturias.'
788*{'date': 'September'
column2: 'text': 'The Byzantines are defeated by an Abbasid army in the Battle of Kopidnados.'

column1: 788*{'text': "Start of the period covered in Adam of Bremen's history of the archbishopry of Hamburg."
789*{'text': 'An uprising in Japan leads to a major defeat for Emperor Kammu
column2: alongside a severe drought and famine.'

column1: 789*{'text': 'Caustantín becomes king of the Picts.'
789*{'text': 'Herford is founded by Charlemagne.'
789*{'text': 'The Admonitio Generalis is passed by Charlemagne.'
789*{'text': 'Eadburh marries Beorhtric of Wessex.'
789*{'text': 'The Anglo-Saxon Chronicle records the first appearance of Vikings in England.'
731*{'text': 'Battle of the Defile between the Umayyads and the Turgesh results in heavy casualties for the Umayyad army
column2: halting Muslim expansion in Central Asia for almost two decades.'

column1: 731*{'text': 'Bede completes his Historia ecclesiastica gentis Anglorum.'
731*{'text': 'Pope Gregory III elected by acclamation as the 90th pope during the funeral procession for Pope Gregory II; he is consecrated bishop a month later.'
731*{'text': 'Pope Gregory III condemns Iconoclasm.'
730*{'text': 'Charles Martel defeats the last independent dukedom of the Alamanni
column2: and launches raids on the Saxons beyond the Rhine.'

column1: 730*{'date': 'September/October'
column2: 'text': 'Umayyad troops sack the Byzantine fortress of Charsianon.'

column1: 730*{'text': 'Emperor Leo III of the Byzantine Empire orders the destruction of all icons
733*{'text': "Leo III the Isaurian withdraws the Balkans
column2: Sicily and Calabria from the jurisdiction of the pope
column3: in response to Gregory III's support of a revolt in Italy against iconoclasm."

column1: 732*{'date': 'June 26'
732*{'text': 'Egbert becomes bishop of York.'
735*{'text': 'A smallpox epidemic starts in Ancient Japan
735*{'text': 'Khöshöö Tsaidam Monuments of Bilge Khan of Turkish Khanate his brother Kül Tigin.'
734*{'text': 'The Franks defeat the Frisians in the Battle of the Boarn.'
737*{'text': "Favila becomes king of Asturias after Pelayo's death."
737*{'text': 'The Danevirke fortification system is started in Denmark.'
737*{'text': 'Domenico Leone appointed Roman consul and magister militum.'
737*{'text': 'The smallpox epidemic ends in Ancient Japan

736*{'text': 'The scholar-priest Rōben invites Shinshō to give lectures on the Avatamsaka Sutra at Kinshōsen-ji (later Tōdai-ji); this event is considered to be the roots of the Kegon school of Buddhism founded in Japan.'

736*{'text': 'The first instance is documented of hop cultivation in the Hallertau region of present-day Germany (which is today the most important production centre with about 25% of the worldwide production).'
739*{'text': 'Charles Martel drives the Moorish invaders out of Gauls.'
739*{'text': 'The reign of the House of Ukil starts in Bulgaria with King Kormisosh.'
739*{'text': 'Alfonso I becomes king of Asturias.'
739*{'text': 'Theodatus Ursus appointed Consul of the Roman Empire and Magister militum.'
739*{'text': 'Thawra revolt in Tanger against the Umayyad rulers.'
739*{'text': 'Pope Gregory III appeals in vain to Charles Martel for help against the expansionist policies of Liutprand
738*{'text': 'Felice Cornicola appointed Roman consul and magister militum.'
738*{'text': 'The powerful Mayan city-state Xukpi (Copán) is defeated by a rival city-state
738*{'text': 'Saint Boniface visits Rome
column2: and goes on to establish bishoprics in Bavaria.'

column1: 753*{'text': 'Samarkand is conquered by Arabs.'
753*{'text': 'The town of Staraja Ladoga is founded in Russia.'
753*{'text': 'The Synod of Constantinople is called by Emperor Constantine V.'
752*{'text': 'Cuthred of Wessex leads a successful rebellion against Aethelbald of Mercia at Battle Edge
752*{'text': 'First Muslim assault on Sardegna under Abd al-Rahman b. Habib.'
752*{'text': "Yaxun B'alam IV becomes king of Yaxchilan after a ten year struggle for the throne."
752*{'date': 'March 23'
column3: but dies three days after and is not considered legitimate because he was not consecrated.'

column1: 752*{'date': 'March 26'
column2: 'text': 'Pope Stephen II (sometimes referred to as Stephen III) succeeds Pope Zachary as the 92nd pope.'

column1: 752*{'text': 'Retired Emperor Shōmu takes part in the dedication ceremony of the great statue of Vairocana Buddha at the Tōdai-ji
751*{'text': 'Pepin the Short is elected as king of the Franks by the Frankish nobility
column2: marking the end of the Merovingian and beginning of the Carolingian dynasty.'

column1: 751*{'text': 'The Lombard king Aistulf captures Ravenna and the Romagna
column2: ending the Byzantine Exarchate of Ravenna.'

column1: 751*{'text': 'The Japanese poetry anthology Kaifūsō is assembled.'
751*{'text': 'The oldest surviving printed document
751*{'text': 'Theodore succeeds Theophylact as Orthodox Patriarch of Antioch.'
751*{'text': 'Silla minister Gim Daeseong orders construction to begin on the Bulguksa and Seokguram temples at Gyeongju.'
750*{'text': 'Gopala is proclaimed as the first ruler of the Pala Empire.'
750*{'text': 'The Ghana Empire begins.'
750*{'text': 'Teotihuacan in Mexico is destroyed.'
750*{'text': 'The Western Paradise of Amitabha Buddha
column2: detail of a wall painting in Cave 217

column1: 757*{'date': 'March 9'
column2: 'text': 'A major earthquake strikes Palestine and Syria.'

column1: 757*{'text': 'The Battle of Suiyang is fought.'
757*{'text': 'Offa becomes king of Mercia (to 796).'
757*{'text': 'Fruela I becomes king of Asturias.'
757*{'text': 'Tassilo III
column3: recognizes the supremacy of Frankish king Pepin the Short.'

column2: 'text': 'Pope Paul I succeeds Pope Stephen II as the 93rd pope.'

column1: 756*{'text': 'Pepin the Short defeats the Lombards of northern Italy
column2: who have threatened Pope Stephen II.'

column1: 756*{'text': 'Desiderius succeeds Aistulf as king of the Lombards.'
756*{'text': 'Vinekh succeeds Kormisosh as king of Bulgaria.'
756*{'text': "The army of An Lushan captures Chang'an in rebellion against the Tang Dynasty."
756*{'text': 'Yang Guozhong is killed by the angry soldiers
column2: Yang Guifei and most people in the family of Yang are killed.'

column1: 756*{'text': 'Emperor Suzong of Tang China ascends to the throne
column2: after his father Emperor Xuanzong abdicates while fleeing to Sichuan during the An Lushan rebellion.'

column1: 756*{'text': 'The Tang army
755*{'text': 'Pepin the Short sends his armies into Italy to aid the pope against the Lombards.'
755*{'text': 'Cynewulf deposes King Sebright of Wessex and takes the kingdom.'
755*{'text': 'The Anglo-Saxon Chronicle suddenly changes in style
column2: from short descriptions to true short stories.'

column1: 755*{'date': 'December 16'
column2: 'text': 'An Lushan begins the Anshi Rebellion against the Tang Dynasty state of China.'

column1: 755*{'text': 'Trisong Detsen becomes King of Tibet.'
754*{'text': 'Pope Stephen II crowns Pepin the short King of the Franks at Saint-Denis outside Paris; also dedicates the foundations of the new abbey church.'
754*{'text': 'Fire breaks out in Canterbury.'
754*{'text': 'The oldest document mentioning the city of Ferrara is from this year (approximate date).'
754*{'text': 'The Iconoclast Council of Hieria meets.'
759*{'text': 'The Franks capture Narbonne; the Saracens are completely driven out of France.'
759*{'text': 'Exceptional winter in England.'
759*{'text': 'Saint Bregwin is appointed Archbishop of Canterbury.'
759*{'text': 'The Tōshōdai-ji Buddhist Temple is founded in Nara
758*{'text': 'Emperor Junnin succeeds Empress Kōken on the throne of Japan.'
758*{'date': 'June 11'
column2: 'text': "Abbasid Arabs and Uyghur Turks arrive simultaneously at Chang'an
column4: in order to offer tribute to the imperial court."

column1: 758*{'text': 'Swithred is succeeded by Sigeric as King of Essex.'
758*{'text': "The moderate Ibadites under the Persian 'Abd al-Rahman Iban Rustam conquer Kairouan and massacre the Sofrites Kharijites."
726*{'text': 'Orso Ipato is elected Doge of Venice and appointed Roman consul by Emperor Leo III the Isaurian.'
726*{'text': 'Dúngal mac Selbaig is deposed as king of Dál Riata; Eochaid mac Echdach becomes king.'
726*{'text': 'The first annual Sumo tournament in Japan is held by Emperor Seibu.'
726*{'text': 'Umayyad forces under Maslamah ibn Abd al-Malik sack the Byzantine city of Caesarea.'
726*{'text': 'Leo III the Isaurian bans the worship of religious images
727*{'text': "Umayyad troops under Abdallah al-Battal and Mu'awiyah ibn Hisham raze Gangra and unsuccessfully besiege Nicaea."
727*{'text': 'Pope Gregory II condemns iconoclasm
column2: causing Byzantine Italy to break with the Empire.'

column1: 724*{'text': 'Emperor Shōmu succeeds Empress Genshō on the throne of Japan.'
724*{'text': 'Umayyad caliph Yazid II ibn Abd al-Malik (720–724) is succeeded by Hisham ibn Abd al-Malik (724–743).'
725*{'text': 'Bede writes On the reckoning of time (De temporum ratione) explaining how to calculate medieval Easter.'
722*{'text': 'The Battle of Covadonga marks the first victory of a Christian army over a Muslim army in Spain (probable date).'
722*{'text': 'A combined Viking and Cornish army defeat an army of Wessex at the Battle of Hehil.'
722*{'text': 'The Battle of Allen was fought in close proximity to the Hill of Allen
column3: led by Murchad mac Brain Mut
column4: and the forces of Fergal mac Máele Dúin.'

column1: 723*{'text': "Saint Boniface fells Thor's Oak near Fritzlar
column2: marking the decisive event in the Christianization of the northern Germanic tribes."

column1: 723*{'text': "The world's first mechanical clock is allegedly built in China (See celestial globe)."
720*{'text': 'The Nihon Shoki (日本書紀)
column2: one of the oldest history books in Japan

column1: 720*{'text': 'Umayyad caliph Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz is succeeded by Yazid II ibn Abd al-Malik.'
720*{'text': "The former governor of Iraq
column3: rebels and is defeated and killed by the Caliph's forces under Al-Abbas ibn al-Walid and Maslamah ibn Abd al-Malik."

column1: 720*{'text': 'The Byzantine emperor Leo III the Isaurian orders the execution of the ex-emperor Anastasius II.'
721*{'text': 'Theuderic IV succeeds Chilperic II as king of the Franks.'
721*{'text': 'Anbasa ibn Suhaim Al Kalbi is appointed governor of Al-Andalus.'
721*{'text': 'Prague is founded (according to legend) by the Princess Libuše and her husband Přemysl
column2: founder of the dynasty with the same name.'

column1: 728*{'text': 'Liutprand
column2: King of the Lombards occupies all of the exarchate.'

column1: 729*{'text': 'The Battle of Ravenna is fought between the troops of Byzantine Emperor Leo III the Isaurian
column3: raised by Pope Gregory II in defence of image worship

column1: 740*{'date': 'October 26'
column2: 'text': "An earthquake strikes Constantinople and the surrounding countryside
column3: causing destruction to the city's land walls and buildings

column1: 740*{'text': 'The reign of King Sevar
column2: and thus of the House of Dulo

column1: 740*{'text': 'Pippin III marries Bertrada of Laon.'
740*{'date': 'September'
740*{'text': 'Battle of Akroinon in Anatolia
column2: a significant Byzantine victory over the Umayyads
column3: halts the impetus of Arab attacks into Anatolia.'

column1: 740*{'text': 'The Khazars
column2: a nation of the Black Sea steppe

column1: 740*{'text': 'St. Cuthbert becomes archbishop of Canterbury.'
741*{'text': 'Carloman
column2: Pippin the Short and Grifo succeed their father Charles Martel as Mayor of the Palace.'

column1: 741*{'text': 'The York Minster Church is burned.'
741*{'text': 'John Fabriaco is appointed Roman consul and magister militum.'
741*{'date': 'June 18'
column2: 'text': 'Constantine V succeeds Leo III as emperor of the Byzantine Empire.'

column1: 741*{'text': 'A nunnery given by the Alamannic noblewoman Beata on Lützelau island is first mentioned.'
741*{'text': 'Ufenau island in Switzerland is first mentioned in 741 as "Hupinauia"
741*{'text': 'A fourth expedition sent from Syria by the Umayyad caliphate to crush the rebellion in the Atlas region is defeated in the plain of the Ghrab (nowadays Morocco).'
741*{'date': 'December 10'
column2: 'text': 'Pope Zachary succeeds Pope Gregory III as the 91st pope.'

column1: 742*{'text': 'Artabasdus is Byzantine Emperor until the capital is stormed by Constantine V
column2: who regains control and resumes the suppression of image-worship.'

column1: 742*{'text': "Emperor Xuanzong of Tang begins to favor Taoism over Buddhism
column2: adopting the new reign title Tianbao ('Heavenly Treasures') to indicate his divine mandate."

column1: 742*{'text': "China's population reaches approximately 50 million."
742*{'text': 'The Arabs suppress a revolt of the Kharajites and the Berbers.'
742*{'text': 'Liutprand
column3: absorbs the independent duchies of Spoleto and Benevento into his kingdom.'

column1: 742*{'text': 'Saint Sturm establishes the abbey of Fulda (or 744?.'
742*{'text': 'Chrodegang
column3: is appointed bishop of Metz and embarks on a reorganisation of the Frankish church.'

column1: 742*{'text': 'The Holy Face of Lucca is transferred to Lucca from Luni (traditional date).'
743*{'text': 'The Concilium Germanicum
column2: organized by Carloman and Saint Boniface
column3: is the first major synod held in the Frankish church.'

column1: 743*{'text': 'Constantine V re-ascends the throne of the Byzantine Empire.'
743*{'text': 'Umayyad caliph Hisham ibn Abd al-Malik (724–743) is succeeded by al-Walid II ibn Abd al-Malik (743–744).'
744*{'date': 'February'
column2: 'text': 'Hildeprand succeeds Liutprand as king of the Lombards.'

column1: 744*{'date': 'October'
column2: 'text': 'Ratchis succeeds Hildeprand as king of the Lombards.'

column1: 744*{'text': 'A nunnery given by the Alamannic noblewoman Beata on Lützelau island is first mentioned in 741.'
744*{'text': 'Ufenau island in Switzerland is first mentioned in 741 as "Hupinauia"
744*{'text': 'Umayyad caliph al-Walid II dies and is succeeded by his brother Yazid III
744*{'text': "The Synod of Soissons meets at the instigation of Pippin
column3: the Pope's missionary to pagan Germany
column4: secures the condemnation of Frankish bishop Adalbert and Irish missionary Clement."

column1: 744*{'date': 'March 3'
744*{'text': 'Saint Sturm establishes the monastery of Fulda.'
744*{'text': 'Salih ibn Tarif proclaims himself a prophet among the Berghouata of Morocco.'
745*{'text': 'Bubonic plague in Constantinople subsequently sweeps through Europe.'
746*{'text': 'Byzantine forces regain Cyprus from the Arabs.'
746*{'text': 'Swithred succeeds Saelred as king of Essex.'
746*{'text': 'The nobility of the Alamanni is killed at the blood court at Cannstatt.'
746*{'text': 'The monastery at Tegernsee in Bavaria began brewing its own beer.'
746*{'text': 'Jayshikhari Chavda establishes the Chavda Dynasty in Gujarat
746*{'text': 'Guru Rinpoche
column3: traveled to Bhutan to cure the king of Bumthang.'

column1: 747*{'text': 'Abu Muslim unites the Abbasid Empire against the Umayyads.'
747*{'text': 'Ibrahim the Imam
column2: leader of an Abbasid revolt against the Umayyads

column1: 747*{'text': 'Emperor Xuanzong of Tang China abolishes the death penalty.'
747*{'text': 'The Shin-Yakushi-ji Buddhist temple is founded.'
747*{'text': 'Carloman retires into a monastery.'
747*{'text': 'Plague breaks out in Sicily
748*{'date': 'January'
column2: 'text': 'An earthquake strikes the Middle East from northern Egypt to northwestern Mesopotamia
column3: destroying many remnants of Byzantine culture.'

column1: 748*{'date': 'February 14'
column2: 'text': 'The Hashimi rebels under Abu Muslim take Marv
column3: the capital of the province of Khurasan
column4: marking the consolidation of the Abbasid revolt.'

column1: 748*{'text': 'The city of Baalbek is sacked.'
748*{'text': 'The plague breaks out in Constantinople.'
748*{'text': 'The first printed newspaper appears in Beijing
749*{'date': 'June'
column3: Ratchis as king of the Lombards.'

column1: 749*{'text': "Abbasid forces under Qahtaba ibn Shabib al-Ta'i defeat a large Ummayad army at Isfahan and move into Iraq
749*{'text': 'Golan earthquake of 749.'
775*{'text': 'Dharampala begins his reign of Bengal.'
775*{'text': 'Leo IV succeeds Constantine V as Byzantine Emperor.'
775*{'text': 'Alpin II succeeds Ciniod I as king of the Picts.'
775*{'text': 'Charlemagne begins his campaign into Westphalia.'
775*{'text': 'The German city of Gießen is formed.'
774*{'text': 'Charlemagne conquers the kingdom of the Lombards
column2: and takes title King of the Lombards.'

column1: 774*{'text': 'Silo succeeds Aurelio as king of Asturias.'
777*{'text': 'Ibn Rustam is recognized imam of the Ibadis in Maghrib.'
777*{'text': 'Charlemagne defeats the Saxons; their leader Widukind flees to Denmark.'
776*{'date': 'April 14'
column2: 'text': 'Charlemagne spends Easter in Treviso after putting down a revolt by Friuli and Spoleto
column6: and signing a treaty with Hildeprand

column1: 776*{'text': 'The Battle of Otford is fought between Mercia and Kent.'
771*{'date': 'December 4'
column5: leaving his brother Charlemagne king of the now complete Frankish kingdom.'

column1: 771*{'text': 'Gerberga
770*{'text': 'Emperor Kōnin ascends to the throne of Japan
770*{'text': 'Hedeby is founded.'
770*{'text': 'Telerig becomes king of Bulgaria
773*{'text': 'The concept of the number zero is introduced to the city of Baghdad.'
772*{'text': 'Offa of Mercia conquers Sussex (approximate date).'
772*{'date': 'February 9'
column2: 'text': 'Pope Adrian I (also referred to as Hadrian) succeeds Pope Stephen III as the 95th pope.'

column1: 772*{'text': 'Caliph Al-Mansur orders Christians and Jews in Jerusalem to be stamped on their hands with a distinctive symbol.'
779*{'text': 'June 12 - In China
column2: Li Kuo succeeds as Emperor Dezong of Tang.'

column1: 779*{'text': 'Offa of Mercia defeats Cynewulf of Wessex and takes Bensington.'
779*{'text': "Offa's Dyke is constructed."
778*{'text': 'Charlemagne fights the Moors in Spain.'
778*{'text': 'Widukind returns to Saxony from Denmark.'
800*{'text': "December 25 - Pope Leo III crowns Charlemagne Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire in Saint Peter's Basilica in Rome."
800*{'text': 'Itza culture starts in Mesoamerica (approximate date).'
